page.title: 10Entertainment in Barnburgh.
page.content: Across the road from St. Peters Church is something that the village people fought hard for "The Barnburgh and Harlington Village Hall".The hall was built in 1975 and stands on the site of the old village school.The day to day running of the Village Hall is purely a village concern, and is not supported in any way by grants or endowments from the local or district authorities. The activities held in the hall are as follows: Playgroup,Mother and Toddler Group, Youth Club, Over 60's, Dancing Classes- ballet and tap, Keep-fit and Councillor's Surgery. It also accomodates a village doctor, a child welfare clinic and a chiropodist. The Hall can also be privately booked for weddings,parties and disco's. A village tote is run weekly and provides a valuable source of income.
